It belongs to the family Thismiaceae, a group of plants known for their unique and often subterranean growth habits. The plant is characterized by its lack of leaves and its reliance on mycorrhizal fungi for nutrient uptake, a feature common in many myco-heterotrophic species. Due to its restricted habitat and limited distribution, Thismia gongshanensis is considered a vulnerable species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts in its native environment.
